mn129:33.2.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, rājā cakkavattī sattahi ratanehi samannāgato catūhi ca iddhīhi tatonidānaṁ sukhaṁ somanassaṁ paṭisaṁvedeti.
mn129:33.2.en: “Suppose there was a king, a wheel-turning monarch who possessed seven treasures and four blessings, and experienced pleasure and happiness because of them.

mn129:34.4.pli: ‘sutaṁ kho pana metaṁ yassa rañño khattiyassa muddhāvasittassa tadahuposathe pannarase sīsaṁnhātassa uposathikassa uparipāsādavaragatassa dibbaṁ cakkaratanaṁ pātubhavati sahassāraṁ sanemikaṁ sanābhikaṁ sabbākāraparipūraṁ, so hoti rājā cakkavattīti.
mn129:34.4.en: ‘I have heard that when the heavenly wheel-treasure appears to a king in this way, he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:34.5.pli: Assaṁ nu kho ahaṁ rājā cakkavattī’ti?
mn129:34.5.en: Am I then a wheel-turning monarch?’

mn129:35.4.pli: Ye kho pana, bhikkhave, puratthimāya disāya paṭirājāno te rājānaṁ cakkavattiṁ upasaṅkamitvā evamāhaṁsu:
mn129:35.4.en: And any opposing rulers of the eastern quarter come to the wheel-turning monarch and say,

mn129:35.12.pli: Ye kho pana, bhikkhave, uttarāya disāya paṭirājāno te rājānaṁ cakkavattiṁ upasaṅkamitvā evamāhaṁsu:
mn129:35.12.en: And any opposing rulers of the northern quarter come to the wheel-turning monarch and say,

mn129:35.18.pli: Rañño, bhikkhave, cakkavattissa evarūpaṁ cakkaratanaṁ pātubhavati.
mn129:35.18.en: Such is the wheel-treasure that appears to the wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:36.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, rañño cakkavattissa hatthiratanaṁ pātubhavati—
mn129:36.1.en: Next, the elephant-treasure appears to the wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:36.6.pli: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhikkhave, rājā cakkavattī tameva hatthiratanaṁ vīmaṁsamāno pubbaṇhasamayaṁ abhiruhitvā samuddapariyantaṁ pathaviṁ anusaṁyāyitvā tameva rājadhāniṁ paccāgantvā pātarāsamakāsi.
mn129:36.6.en: Once it so happened that the wheel-turning monarch, testing that same elephant-treasure, mounted him in the morning and traversed the land surrounded by ocean before returning to the royal capital in time for breakfast.

mn129:36.7.pli: Rañño, bhikkhave, cakkavattissa evarūpaṁ hatthiratanaṁ pātubhavati.
mn129:36.7.en: Such is the elephant-treasure that appears to the wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:37.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, rañño cakkavattissa assaratanaṁ pātubhavati—
mn129:37.1.en: Next, the horse-treasure appears to the wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:37.6.pli: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhikkhave, rājā cakkavattī tameva assaratanaṁ vīmaṁsamāno pubbaṇhasamayaṁ abhiruhitvā samuddapariyantaṁ pathaviṁ anusaṁyāyitvā tameva rājadhāniṁ paccāgantvā pātarāsamakāsi.
mn129:37.6.en: Once it so happened that the wheel-turning monarch, testing that same horse-treasure, mounted him in the morning and traversed the land surrounded by ocean before returning to the royal capital in time for breakfast.

mn129:37.7.pli: Rañño, bhikkhave, cakkavattissa evarūpaṁ assaratanaṁ pātubhavati.
mn129:37.7.en: Such is the horse-treasure that appears to the wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:38.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, rañño cakkavattissa maṇiratanaṁ pātubhavati.
mn129:38.1.en: Next, the jewel-treasure appears to the wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:38.4.pli: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhikkhave, rājā cakkavattī tameva maṇiratanaṁ vīmaṁsamāno caturaṅginiṁ senaṁ sannayhitvā maṇiṁ dhajaggaṁ āropetvā rattandhakāratimisāya pāyāsi.
mn129:38.4.en: Once it so happened that the wheel-turning monarch, testing that same jewel-treasure, mobilized his army of four divisions and, with the jewel hoisted on his banner, set out in the dark of the night.

mn129:38.6.pli: Rañño, bhikkhave, cakkavattissa evarūpaṁ maṇiratanaṁ pātubhavati.
mn129:38.6.en: Such is the jewel-treasure that appears to the wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:39.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, rañño cakkavattissa itthiratanaṁ pātubhavati.
mn129:39.1.en: Next, the woman-treasure appears to the wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:39.7.pli: Taṁ kho pana, bhikkhave, itthiratanaṁ rājānaṁ cakkavattiṁ manasāpi no aticarati, kuto pana kāyena?
mn129:39.7.en: The woman-treasure does not betray the wheel-turning monarch even in thought, still less in deed.

mn129:39.8.pli: Rañño, bhikkhave, cakkavattissa evarūpaṁ itthiratanaṁ pātubhavati.
mn129:39.8.en: Such is the woman-treasure who appears to the wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:40.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, rañño cakkavattissa gahapatiratanaṁ pātubhavati.
mn129:40.1.en: Next, the householder-treasure appears to the wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:40.3.en: He approaches the wheel-turning monarch and says,

mn129:40.5.pli: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhikkhave, rājā cakkavattī tameva gahapatiratanaṁ vīmaṁsamāno nāvaṁ abhiruhitvā majjhe gaṅgāya nadiyā sotaṁ ogāhitvā gahapatiratanaṁ etadavoca:
mn129:40.5.en: Once it so happened that the wheel-turning monarch, testing that same householder-treasure, boarded a boat and sailed to the middle of the Ganges river. Then he said to the householder-treasure,

mn129:40.13.pli: Rañño, bhikkhave, cakkavattissa evarūpaṁ gahapatiratanaṁ pātubhavati.
mn129:40.13.en: Such is the householder-treasure that appears to the wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:41.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, rañño cakkavattissa pariṇāyakaratanaṁ pātubhavati—
mn129:41.1.en: Next, the counselor-treasure appears to the wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:41.3.en: He approaches the wheel-turning monarch and says,

mn129:41.5.pli: Rañño, bhikkhave, cakkavattissa evarūpaṁ pariṇāyakaratanaṁ pātubhavati.
mn129:41.5.en: Such is the counselor-treasure that appears to the wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:41.6.pli: Rājā, bhikkhave, cakkavattī imehi sattahi ratanehi samannāgato hoti.
mn129:41.6.en: These are the seven treasures possessed by a wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:42.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rājā cakkavattī abhirūpo hoti dassanīyo pāsādiko paramāya vaṇṇapokkharatāya samannāgato ativiya aññehi manussehi.
mn129:42.2.en: A wheel-turning monarch is attractive, good-looking, lovely, of surpassing beauty, more so than other people.

mn129:45.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, rājā cakkavattī brāhmaṇagahapatikānaṁ piyo hoti manāpo.
mn129:45.1.en: Furthermore, a wheel-turning monarch is as dear and beloved to the brahmins and householders

mn129:45.4.pli: Raññopi, bhikkhave, cakkavattissa brāhmaṇagahapatikā piyā honti manāpā.
mn129:45.4.en: And the brahmins and householders are as dear to the wheel-turning monarch

mn129:45.7.pli: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhikkhave, rājā cakkavattī caturaṅginiyā senāya uyyānabhūmiṁ niyyāsi.
mn129:45.7.en: Once it so happened that a wheel-turning monarch went with his army of four divisions to visit a park.

mn129:45.13.pli: Rājā, bhikkhave, cakkavattī imāhi catūhi iddhīhi samannāgato hoti.
mn129:45.13.en: These are the four blessings possessed by a wheel-turning monarch.

mn129:46.2.pli: api nu kho rājā cakkavattī imehi sattahi ratanehi samannāgato imāhi catūhi ca iddhīhi tatonidānaṁ sukhaṁ somanassaṁ paṭisaṁvediyethā”ti?
mn129:46.2.en: Would a wheel-turning monarch who possessed these seven treasures and these four blessings experience pleasure and happiness because of them?”

mn129:46.3.pli: “Ekamekenapi, bhante, ratanena samannāgato rājā cakkavattī tatonidānaṁ sukhaṁ somanassaṁ paṭisaṁvediyetha, ko pana vādo sattahi ratanehi catūhi ca iddhīhī”ti?
mn129:46.3.en: “Sir, a wheel-turning monarch who possessed even a single one of these treasures would experience pleasure and happiness because of that, let alone all seven treasures and four blessings!”

mn129:47.5.pli: “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, yaṁ rājā cakkavattī sattahi ratanehi samannāgato catūhi ca iddhīhi tatonidānaṁ sukhaṁ somanassaṁ paṭisaṁvedeti taṁ dibbassa sukhassa upanidhāya saṅkhampi na upeti; kalabhāgampi na upeti; upanidhampi na upeti.
mn129:47.5.en: “In the same way, compared to the happiness of heaven, the pleasure and happiness experienced by a wheel-turning monarch due to those seven treasures and those four blessings doesn’t even count, it’s not even a fraction, there’s no comparison.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 129
The Foolish and the Astute

dn26:2.1.pli: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhikkhave, rājā daḷhanemi nāma ahosi cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
dn26:2.1.en: Once upon a time, mendicants, there was a king named Daḷhanemi who was a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. His dominion extended to all four sides, he achieved stability in the country, and he possessed the seven treasures.

dn26:3.9.pli: yassa rañño cakkavattissa dibbaṁ cakkaratanaṁ osakkati ṭhānā cavati, na dāni tena raññā ciraṁ jīvitabbaṁ hotīti.
dn26:3.9.en: when this happens to a wheel-turning monarch, he does not have long to live.

dn26:4.8.pli: Iṅgha tvaṁ, tāta, ariye cakkavattivatte vattāhi.
dn26:4.8.en: Come now, my dear, implement the noble duties of a wheel-turning monarch.

dn26:5.0.en: 2.1. The Noble Duties of a Wheel-Turning Monarch

dn26:5.1.en: ‘But sire, what are the noble duties of a wheel-turning monarch?’

dn26:5.8.pli: Idaṁ kho, tāta, taṁ ariyaṁ cakkavattivattan’ti.
dn26:5.8.en: These are the noble duties of a wheel-turning monarch.’

dn26:5.10.pli: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, rājā khattiyo muddhābhisitto rājisissa paṭissutvā ariye cakkavattivatte vatti.
dn26:5.10.en: ‘Yes, Your Majesty,’ replied the new king to the royal sage. And he implemented the noble duties of a wheel-turning monarch.

dn26:5.14.pli: ‘sutaṁ kho pana metaṁ—yassa rañño khattiyassa muddhābhisittassa tadahuposathe pannarase sīsaṁnhātassa uposathikassa uparipāsādavaragatassa dibbaṁ cakkaratanaṁ pātubhavati sahassāraṁ sanemikaṁ sanābhikaṁ sabbākāraparipūraṁ, so hoti rājā cakkavattīti.
dn26:5.14.en: ‘I have heard that when the heavenly wheel-treasure appears to a king in this way, he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn26:5.15.pli: Assaṁ nu kho ahaṁ rājā cakkavattī’ti.
dn26:5.15.en: Am I then a wheel-turning monarch?’

dn26:6.4.pli: Ye kho pana, bhikkhave, puratthimāya disāya paṭirājāno, te rājānaṁ cakkavattiṁ upasaṅkamitvā evamāhaṁsu:
dn26:6.4.en: And any opposing rulers of the eastern quarter came to the wheel-turning monarch and said,

dn26:7.11.pli: Ye kho pana, bhikkhave, uttarāya disāya paṭirājāno, te rājānaṁ cakkavattiṁ upasaṅkamitvā evamāhaṁsu:
dn26:7.11.en: And any opposing rulers of the northern quarter came to the wheel-turning monarch and said,

dn26:8.6.pli: sattamopi kho, bhikkhave, rājā cakkavattī bahunnaṁ vassānaṁ bahunnaṁ vassasatānaṁ bahunnaṁ vassasahassānaṁ accayena aññataraṁ purisaṁ āmantesi:
dn26:8.6.en: and a seventh time, a wheel-turning monarch was established in exactly the same way. And after many years the seventh wheel-turning monarch went forth, handing the realm over to the crown prince.

dn26:9.4.pli: no ca kho rājisiṁ upasaṅkamitvā ariyaṁ cakkavattivattaṁ pucchi.
dn26:9.4.en: But he didn’t go to the royal sage and ask about the noble duties of a wheel-turning monarch.

dn26:9.6.pli: Tassa samatena janapadaṁ pasāsato pubbenāparaṁ janapadā na pabbanti, yathā taṁ pubbakānaṁ rājūnaṁ ariye cakkavattivatte vattamānānaṁ.
dn26:9.6.en: So governed, the nations did not prosper like before, as they had when former kings implemented the noble duties of a wheel-turning monarch.

dn26:9.8.pli: ‘na kho te, deva, samatena sudaṁ janapadaṁ pasāsato pubbenāparaṁ janapadā pabbanti, yathā taṁ pubbakānaṁ rājūnaṁ ariye cakkavattivatte vattamānānaṁ.
dn26:9.8.en: ‘Sire, when governed according to your own ideas, the nations do not prosper like before, as they did when former kings implemented the noble duties of a wheel-turning monarch.

dn26:9.9.pli: Saṁvijjanti kho te, deva, vijite amaccā pārisajjā gaṇakamahāmattā anīkaṭṭhā dovārikā mantassājīvino mayañceva aññe ca ye mayaṁ ariyaṁ cakkavattivattaṁ dhārema.
dn26:9.9.en: In your realm are found ministers and counselors, treasury officials, military officers, guardsmen, and advisers—both ourselves and others—who remember the noble duties of a wheel-turning monarch.

dn26:9.10.pli: Iṅgha tvaṁ, deva, amhe ariyaṁ cakkavattivattaṁ puccha.
dn26:9.10.en: Please, Your Majesty, ask us about the noble duties of a wheel-turning monarch.

dn26:10.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, rājā khattiyo muddhābhisitto amacce pārisajje gaṇakamahāmatte anīkaṭṭhe dovārike mantassājīvino sannipātetvā ariyaṁ cakkavattivattaṁ pucchi.
dn26:10.1.en: So the anointed king asked the assembled ministers and counselors, treasury officials, military officers, guardsmen, and advisers about the noble duties of a wheel-turning monarch.

dn26:24.1.pli: Asītivassasahassāyukesu, bhikkhave, manussesu ketumatiyā rājadhāniyā saṅkho nāma rājā uppajjissati cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
dn26:24.1.en: And in the royal capital of Ketumati a king named Saṅkha will arise, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. His dominion will extend to all four sides, he will achieve stability in the country, and possess the seven treasures.

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 26
The Wheel-Turning Monarch
1. Taking Refuge in Oneself

dn30:1.1.8.pli: Sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
dn30:1.1.8.en: If he stays at home he becomes a king, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. His dominion extends to all four sides, he achieves stability in the country, and he possesses the seven treasures.

dn30:1.5.1.pli: So tena lakkhaṇena samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
dn30:1.5.1.en: Possessing this mark, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:1.8.1.pli: So tena lakkhaṇena samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:1.8.1.en: Possessing this mark, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:1.11.1.pli: So tehi lakkhaṇehi samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:1.11.1.en: Possessing these marks, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:1.14.1.pli: So tena lakkhaṇena samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:1.14.1.en: Possessing this mark, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:1.17.1.pli: So tehi lakkhaṇehi samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:1.17.1.en: Possessing these marks, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:1.20.1.pli: So tehi lakkhaṇehi samannāgato, sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:1.20.1.en: Possessing these marks, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:1.23.1.pli: So tena lakkhaṇena samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:1.23.1.en: Possessing this mark, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:1.26.1.pli: So tena lakkhaṇena samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:1.26.1.en: Possessing this mark, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:1.29.1.pli: So tena lakkhaṇena samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:1.29.1.en: Possessing this mark, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:1.32.1.pli: So tena lakkhaṇena samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:1.32.1.en: Possessing this mark, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:2.2.1.pli: So tehi lakkhaṇehi samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:2.2.1.en: Possessing these marks, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:2.5.1.pli: So tehi lakkhaṇehi samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:2.5.1.en: Possessing these marks, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:2.8.1.pli: So tena lakkhaṇena samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:2.8.1.en: Possessing this mark, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:2.11.1.pli: So tehi lakkhaṇehi samannāgato, sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:2.11.1.en: Possessing these marks, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:2.14.1.pli: So tena lakkhaṇena samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:2.14.1.en: Possessing this mark, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:2.17.1.pli: So tehi lakkhaṇehi samannāgato, sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:2.17.1.en: Possessing these marks, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:2.20.1.pli: So tehi lakkhaṇehi samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:2.20.1.en: Possessing these marks, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:2.23.1.pli: So tehi lakkhaṇehi samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:2.23.1.en: Possessing these marks, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:2.26.1.pli: So tena lakkhaṇena samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī …pe…
dn30:2.26.1.en: Possessing this mark, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn30:2.29.1.pli: So tehi lakkhaṇehi samannāgato sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
dn30:2.29.1.en: Possessing these marks, if he stays at home he becomes a king, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. His dominion extends to all four sides, he achieves stability in the country, and he possesses the seven treasures.

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 30
The Marks of a Great Man

dn16:5.11.2.pli: “Yathā kho, ānanda, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti, evaṁ tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabban”ti.
dn16:5.11.2.en: “Proceed in the same way as they do for the corpse of a wheel-turning monarch.”

dn16:5.11.3.pli: “Kathaṁ pana, bhante, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjantī”ti?
dn16:5.11.3.en: “But how do they proceed with a wheel-turning monarch’s corpse?”

dn16:5.11.4.pli: “Rañño, ānanda, cakkavattissa sarīraṁ ahatena vatthena veṭhenti, ahatena vatthena veṭhetvā vihatena kappāsena veṭhenti, vihatena kappāsena veṭhetvā ahatena vatthena veṭhenti.
dn16:5.11.4.en: “They wrap a wheel-turning monarch’s corpse with unworn cloth, then with uncarded cotton, then again with unworn cloth.

dn16:5.11.6.en: They build a monument for the wheel-turning monarch at the crossroads.

dn16:5.11.7.pli: Evaṁ kho, ānanda, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti.
dn16:5.11.7.en: That’s how they proceed with a wheel-turning monarch’s corpse.

dn16:5.12.3.pli: Tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho thūpāraho, paccekasambuddho thūpāraho, tathāgatassa sāvako thūpāraho, rājā cakkavattī thūpārahoti.
dn16:5.12.3.en: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha; a Buddha awakened for themselves; a disciple of a Realized One; and a wheel-turning monarch.

dn16:5.12.16.pli: Kiñcānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca rājā cakkavattī thūpāraho?
dn16:5.12.16.en: And for what reason is a wheel-turning monarch worthy of a monument?

dn16:5.12.19.pli: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca rājā cakkavattī thūpāraho.
dn16:5.12.19.en: It is for this reason that a wheel-turning monarch is worthy of a monument.

dn16:5.16.16.pli: Cattārome, bhikkhave, acchariyā abbhutā dhammā raññe cakkavattimhi.
dn16:5.16.16.en: There are these four incredible and amazing things about a wheel-turning monarch.

dn16:5.16.18.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, khattiyaparisā rājānaṁ cakkavattiṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
dn16:5.16.18.en: If an assembly of aristocrats goes to see a wheel-turning monarch, they’re uplifted by seeing him

dn16:5.16.23.pli: samaṇaparisā rājānaṁ cakkavattiṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
dn16:5.16.23.en: or ascetics goes to see a wheel-turning monarch, they’re uplifted by seeing him

dn16:5.18.1.pli: Bhūtapubbaṁ, ānanda, rājā mahāsudassano nāma ahosi cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
dn16:5.18.1.en: Once upon a time there was a king named Mahāsudassana who was a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. His dominion extended to all four sides, he achieved stability in the country, and he possessed the seven treasures.

dn16:6.17.3.pli: “Yathā kho, vāseṭṭhā, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti, evaṁ tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabban”ti.
dn16:6.17.3.en: “Proceed in the same way as they do for the corpse of a wheel-turning monarch.”

dn16:6.17.4.pli: “Kathaṁ pana, bhante ānanda, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjantī”ti?
dn16:6.17.4.en: “But how do they proceed with a wheel-turning monarch’s corpse?”

dn16:6.17.5.pli: “Rañño, vāseṭṭhā, cakkavattissa sarīraṁ ahatena vatthena veṭhenti, ahatena vatthena veṭhetvā vihatena kappāsena veṭhenti, vihatena kappāsena veṭhetvā ahatena vatthena veṭhenti.
dn16:6.17.5.en: “They wrap a wheel-turning monarch’s corpse with unworn cloth, then with uncarded cotton, then again with unworn cloth.

dn16:6.17.7.en: They build a monument for the wheel-turning monarch at the crossroads.

dn16:6.17.8.pli: Evaṁ kho, vāseṭṭhā, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti.
dn16:6.17.8.en: That’s how they proceed with a wheel-turning monarch’s corpse.

an4.130:0.3.en: 130. Incredible Things About the Wheel-Turning Monarch

an4.130:1.1.pli: “Cattārome, bhikkhave, acchariyā abbhutā dhammā raññe cakkavattimhi.
an4.130:1.1.en: “Mendicants, there are these four incredible and amazing things about a wheel-turning monarch.

an4.130:1.3.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, khattiyaparisā rājānaṁ cakkavattiṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanenapi sā attamanā hoti.
an4.130:1.3.en: If an assembly of aristocrats goes to see a wheel-turning monarch, they’re uplifted by seeing him

an4.130:4.1.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, samaṇaparisā rājānaṁ cakkavattiṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanenapi sā attamanā hoti.
an4.130:4.1.en: or ascetics goes to see a wheel-turning monarch, they’re uplifted by seeing him

an4.130:4.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro acchariyā abbhutā dhammā raññe cakkavattimhi.
an4.130:4.4.en: These are the four incredible and amazing things about a wheel-turning monarch.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 4
13. Fears
130. Incredible Things About the Wheel-Turning Monarch

dn17:1.7.6.pli: ‘sutaṁ kho pana metaṁ: “yassa rañño khattiyassa muddhāvasittassa tadahuposathe pannarase sīsaṁnhātassa uposathikassa uparipāsādavaragatassa dibbaṁ cakkaratanaṁ pātubhavati sahassāraṁ sanemikaṁ sanābhikaṁ sabbākāraparipūraṁ, so hoti rājā cakkavattī”ti.
dn17:1.7.6.en: ‘I have heard that when the heavenly wheel-treasure appears to a king in this way, he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.

dn17:1.7.7.pli: Assaṁ nu kho ahaṁ rājā cakkavattī’ti.
dn17:1.7.7.en: Am I then a wheel-turning monarch?’

dn17:1.15.7.pli: Taṁ kho panānanda, itthiratanaṁ rājānaṁ mahāsudassanaṁ manasāpi no aticari, kuto pana kāyena.
dn17:1.15.7.en: The woman-treasure did not betray the wheel-turning monarch even in thought, still less in deed.

dn17:1.16.5.pli: Bhūtapubbaṁ, ānanda, rājā mahāsudassano tameva gahapatiratanaṁ vīmaṁsamāno nāvaṁ abhiruhitvā majjhe gaṅgāya nadiyā sotaṁ ogāhitvā gahapatiratanaṁ etadavoca:
dn17:1.16.5.en: Once it so happened that the wheel-turning monarch, testing that same householder-treasure, boarded a boat and sailed to the middle of the Ganges river. Then he said to the householder-treasure,

dn17:2.17.1.pli: Chakkhattuṁ kho panāhaṁ, ānanda, abhijānāmi imasmiṁ padese sarīraṁ nikkhipitaṁ, tañca kho rājāva samāno cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato, ayaṁ sattamo sarīranikkhepo.
dn17:2.17.1.en: Six times, Ānanda, I recall having laid down my body at this place. And the seventh time was as a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king, at which time my dominion extended to all four sides, I achieved stability in the country, and I possessed the seven treasures.

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 17
King Mahāsudassana

sn46.42:1.1.pli: “Rañño, bhikkhave, cakkavattissa pātubhāvā sattannaṁ ratanānaṁ pātubhāvo hoti.
sn46.42:1.1.en: “Mendicants, when a Wheel-Turning Monarch appears seven treasures appear.

sn46.42:1.4.pli: Rañño, bhikkhave, cakkavattissa pātubhāvā imesaṁ sattannaṁ ratanānaṁ pātubhāvo hoti.
sn46.42:1.4.en: When a Wheel-Turning Monarch appears these seven treasures appear.

an3.14:1.1.pli: “Yopi so, bhikkhave, rājā cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā sopi na arājakaṁ cakkaṁ vattetī”ti.
an3.14:1.1.en: “Mendicants, even a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king, does not wield power without having their own king.”

an3.14:1.3.pli: “ko pana, bhante, rañño cakkavattissa dhammikassa dhammarañño rājā”ti?
an3.14:1.3.en: “But who is the king of the wheel-turning monarch, the just and principled king?”

an3.14:1.5.pli: “idha, bhikkhu, rājā cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā dhammaṁyeva nissāya dhammaṁ sakkaronto dhammaṁ garuṁ karonto dhammaṁ apacāyamāno dhammaddhajo dhammaketu dhammādhipateyyo dhammikaṁ rakkhāvaraṇaguttiṁ saṁvidahati antojanasmiṁ.
an3.14:1.5.en: “Monk, a wheel-turning monarch provides just protection and security for his court, relying only on principle—honoring, respecting, and venerating principle, having principle as his flag, banner, and authority.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 3
2. The Chariot-Maker
14. The Wheel-Turning Monarch

an1.278:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ ekissā lokadhātuyā dve rājāno cakkavattī apubbaṁ acarimaṁ uppajjeyyuṁ. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
an1.278:1.1.en: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for two wheel-turning monarchs to arise in the same solar system at the same time.

an1.278:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ ekissā lokadhātuyā eko rājā cakkavattī uppajjeyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
an1.278:1.2.en: But it is possible for just one wheel-turning monarch to arise in one solar system.”

an1.280:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ itthī rājā assa cakkavattī. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
an1.280:1.1.en: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a woman to be a wheel-turning monarch.

an1.280:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ puriso rājā assa cakkavattī. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
an1.280:1.2.en: But it is possible for a man to be a wheel-turning monarch.”

sn41.10:1.3.en: “Householder, make a wish to become a wheel-turning monarch in the future!”

sn41.10:2.10.en: ‘Householder, make a wish to become a wheel-turning monarch in the future!’

sn41.10:2.18.pli: anāgatamaddhānaṁ rājā assaṁ cakkavattī’ti, ‘tassa kho ayaṁ ijjhissati, sīlavato cetopaṇidhi visuddhattā dhammiko dhammikaṁ phalaṁ anupassatī’ti.
sn41.10:2.18.en: become a wheel-turning monarch in the future, his heart’s wish will succeed because of the purity of his ethics. And then as a proper, principled king he will provide proper spirit-offerings.’

sn41.10:2.20.en: ‘Householder, make a wish to become a wheel-turning monarch in the future!’

an2.52:1.3.pli: Tathāgato ca arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, rājā ca cakkavattī.
an2.52:1.3.en: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha; and the wheel-turning monarch.

an2.53:1.3.pli: Tathāgato ca arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, rājā ca cakkavattī.
an2.53:1.3.en: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha; and the wheel-turning monarch.

an2.54:1.3.pli: Tathāgatassa ca arahato sammāsambuddhassa, rañño ca cakkavattissa.
an2.54:1.3.en: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha; and the wheel-turning monarch.

an2.55:1.3.pli: Tathāgato ca arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, rājā ca cakkavattī.

mn115:14.3.pli: ‘Aṭṭhānametaṁ anavakāso yaṁ ekissā lokadhātuyā dve rājāno cakkavattino apubbaṁ acarimaṁ uppajjeyyuṁ, netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjatī’ti pajānāti;
mn115:14.3.en: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for two wheel-turning monarchs to arise in the same solar system at the same time.

mn115:14.4.pli: ‘ṭhānañca kho etaṁ vijjati yaṁ ekissā lokadhātuyā eko rājā cakkavattī uppajjeyya, ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī’ti pajānāti.
mn115:14.4.en: But it is possible for just one wheel-turning monarch to arise in one solar system.’

mn115:15.3.pli: ‘Aṭṭhānametaṁ anavakāso yaṁ itthī rājā assa cakkavattī, netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjatī’ti pajānāti;
mn115:15.3.en: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for a woman to be a wheel-turning monarch.

mn115:15.4.pli: ‘ṭhānañca kho etaṁ vijjati yaṁ puriso rājā assa cakkavattī, ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī’ti pajānāti.
mn115:15.4.en: But it is possible for a man to be a wheel-turning monarch.’

Middle Discourses 115
Many Elements

an5.131:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato rājā cakkavattī dhammeneva cakkaṁ vatteti;
an5.131:1.1.en: “Mendicants, possessing five factors a wheel-turning monarch wields power only in a principled manner.

an5.131:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rājā cakkavattī atthaññū ca hoti, dhammaññū ca, mattaññū ca, kālaññū ca, parisaññū ca.
an5.131:2.2.en: A wheel-turning monarch knows what is right, knows principle, knows moderation, knows the right time, and knows the assembly.

an5.131:2.3.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi aṅgehi samannāgato rājā cakkavattī dhammeneva cakkaṁ pavatteti;
an5.131:2.3.en: A wheel-turning monarch who possesses these five factors wields power only in a principled manner.

131. Wielding Power (1st)

an5.132:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato rañño cakkavattissa jeṭṭho putto pitarā pavattitaṁ cakkaṁ dhammeneva anuppavatteti;
an5.132:1.1.en: “Mendicants, possessing five factors a wheel-turning monarch’s eldest son continues to wield the power set in motion by his father only in a principled manner.

an5.132:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rañño cakkavattissa jeṭṭho putto atthaññū ca hoti, dhammaññū ca, mattaññū ca, kālaññū ca, parisaññū ca.
an5.132:2.2.en: A wheel-turning monarch’s oldest son knows what is right, knows principle, knows moderation, knows the right time, and knows the assembly.

an5.132:2.3.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi aṅgehi samannāgato rañño cakkavattissa jeṭṭho putto pitarā pavattitaṁ cakkaṁ dhammeneva anuppavatteti;
an5.132:2.3.en: A wheel-turning monarch’s oldest son who possesses these five factors continues to wield the power set in motion by his father only in a principled manner.

an5.133:2.1.pli: “Idha, bhikkhu, rājā cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā dhammaññeva nissāya dhammaṁ sakkaronto dhammaṁ garuṁ karonto dhammaṁ apacāyamāno dhammaddhajo dhammaketu dhammādhipateyyo dhammikaṁ rakkhāvaraṇaguttiṁ saṁvidahati antojanasmiṁ.

sn55.1:1.3.pli: “kiñcāpi, bhikkhave, rājā cakkavattī catunnaṁ dīpānaṁ issariyādhipaccaṁ rajjaṁ kāretvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati devānaṁ tāvatiṁsānaṁ sahabyataṁ, so tattha nandane vane accharāsaṅghaparivuto dibbehi ca pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricāreti, so catūhi dhammehi asamannāgato, atha kho so aparimuttova nirayā aparimutto tiracchānayoniyā aparimutto pettivisayā aparimutto apāyaduggativinipātā.
sn55.1:1.3.en: “Mendicants, suppose a wheel-turning monarch were to rule as sovereign lord over these four continents. And when his body breaks up, after death, he’s reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm, in the company of the gods of the Thirty-Three. There he entertains himself in the Garden of Delight, escorted by a band of nymphs, and supplied and provided with the five kinds of heavenly sensual stimulation. Still, as he’s lacking four things, he’s not exempt from hell, the animal realm, or the ghost realm. He’s not exempt from places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

mn91:5.4.pli: Sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
mn91:5.4.en: If he stays at home he becomes a king, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. His dominion extends to all four sides, he achieves stability in the country, and he possesses the seven treasures.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 91
With Brahmāyu

dn3:1.5.3.pli: Sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
dn3:1.5.3.en: If he stays at home he becomes a king, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. His dominion extends to all four sides, he achieves stability in the country, and he possesses the seven treasures.
